poem:
Title: "The Story and Its Narrator"

Unfurling tales of the manchild king, 
Through Munro's eyes, we're idly touring.
Religion and power, a beastly ring,
In Stewart courts, drama quietly roaring.

A warning hush in each voluble letter, 
Upon a tapestry of global politics, it's subtly tethered.
Past mirrors the present, aligning together,
In histories' echoes, we're forever weathered.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "James V: Katherine review – romance and religion in the court of a volatile manchild Anyone with half an eye on today’s global politics will know bad things happen when religious zealots come face to face. The same is true in our own history, as Rona Munro reminds us in the latest instalment of her James Play saga about Scotland’s Stewart kings. Compared with the ambitious blockbusters with which she began the series 10 years". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
